About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

Bio

I am currently on exchange at the University of Colorado Boulder as part of my first year in the Masters program. I study software engineering. I received my bachelor's degree in Informatics from the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU).

Growing up, I lived in both Oslo, Norway and the Bay Area, California. I attended high school both places but received my high school diploma from Oslo Handelsgymnasium in 2014.

I have throughout my life always been seeking to do well academically. I am an intellectual curious person, and tend to grasp most academic challenge coming my way. I always strive to do my best – whether it be working independently or with fellow students. I look upon myself as a team player – someone who gets along well with all kinds of people.

Education

  • MSc in Informatics with an emphasis in Software Engineering
  • Bachelor of Science in Information Technology from NTNU
  • High school certificate from Oslo Handelsgymnasium

Experience

  • Active Club Solutions Intern developing a WordPress plugin.
  • Various school projects involving React, Angular, Java, HTML, CSS, mySQL, MongoDB, Gradle, Git, and testing.

Interests

  • I have played the piano for five years and I love to create my own music and upload it to Soundcloud.
  • I have played various team sports including soccer, basketball, and high school tennis.
